author: @infobae
title: Nicaragua y China firman contratos para la construcción de una planta fotovoltaica - Infobae
text:
San José, 3 oct (EFE).- El Gobierno de Nicaragua y la empresa China Communications Construction Company Limited (CCCC) firmaron este jueves en Managua dos contratos para la construcción de una planta fotovaltaica por un costo de 83 millones de dólares y que será utilizada para mejorar los servicios de agua potable en el país centroamericano.
Los contratos fueron suscritos por Nicaragua por el ministro de Hacienda y Crédito Público, Bruno Gallardo, y el presidente ejecutivo de la Empresa Nicaragüense de Acueductos y Alcantarillados Sanitarios (Enacal), Ervin Barreda; y por China por el director de la empresa CCCC para Nicaragua, Xiaobing Zhao.
Los contratos establecen la construcción de una planta de energía fotovoltaica a construirse en el municipio de Masaya, 28 kilómetros al sur de Managua, con una potencia de 70 megavatios, y una inversión de 83 millones de dólares, precisó Laureano Ortega Murillo, hijo del presidente nicaragüense, Daniel Ortega, y de la vicepresidenta Rosario Murillo, quien participó en la firma como testigo.
"Este proyecto tiene múltiples objetivos: En primer lugar potenciar los sistemas de bombeo de la Empresa Nicaragüense de Acueductos y Alcantarillados (Enacal) para mejorar los servicios de agua y saneamiento que se brindan a nuestro pueblo", explicó Ortega Murillo, que ocupa el cargo de asesor presidencial para las Inversiones, Comercio y Cooperación Internacional.
"En segundo lugar, reducir la tarifa energética, a través de una energía más eficiente; y en tercer lugar, aportar al desarrollo sostenible de nuestro país a través de las energías renovables", añadió.
El proyecto 'Construcción de Planta Fotovoltaica para la operación de los sistemas de Enacal' es el tercero de ese tipo que suscriben las autoridades de Nicaragua con la empresa china.
"Con este proyecto sumamos ya tres proyectos de energía solar con la empresa china CCCC, con una capacidad total de generación de 200 megavatios, aportando así a la seguridad y eficiencia energética de Nicaragua, y al desarrollo sostenible del país", destacó Ortega Murillo.
El director de la empresa CCCC, Xiaobing Zhao, se declaró "orgulloso de participar en esta revolución tan exitosa de energía" en Nicaragua.
"Este proyecto no solo contribuirá al cambio de la matriz de generación del país, (sino que) aumentará la proporción de la generación con recursos renovables, también garantizará el suministro sostenible y estable de agua potable para el pueblo de Nicaragua", subrayó.
De los 83 millones de dólares que es el costo de inversión del proyecto, 70,55 millones de dólares serán aportados por la empresa china CCCC.
Con esos 70,55 millones de dólares, el endeudamiento externo del Gobierno de Nicaragua solo con empresas chinas se eleva a 919,72 millones de dólares en lo que va de año.
El 20 de diciembre de 2023, el presidente Ortega calificó de "mejor regalo navideño" y "una gran noticia" el acuerdo entre China y Nicaragua de elevar sus relaciones diplomáticas al grado de "asociación estratégica".
La decisión de elevar las relaciones diplomáticas a "asociación estratégica" se oficializó después de que el presidente chino, Xi Jinping, mantuviera una conversación telefónica con Ortega la noche del 19 de diciembre de 2023.
Las relaciones diplomáticas entre la República Popular China y la República de Nicaragua se establecieron inicialmente en diciembre de 1985, durante el primer Gobierno sandinista (1979-1990).
En 1990, el Gobierno de Violeta Barrios de Chamorro estableció lazos con Taiwán y, finalmente, el 10 de diciembre de 2021 China y Nicaragua reanudaron relaciones diplomáticas después de que el país centroamericano cortara los lazos con Taipei, territorio cuya soberanía reclama China. EFE
(foto)

author: doapp, inc.
title: Boys' basketball notebook: North Fayette Valley's Cael Reichter a double-double machine
text: The 6-foot-8 senior and Upper Iowa University signee is his school\u2019s all-time leader in points, rebounds and steals, and has an active streak of 32 straight games with a points/rebounds double-double

author: ildenaro.it
title: In arrivo lunga Ottobrata con sole e temperatura miti su tutta l’Italia. 24 gradi in Campania
text: In arrivo lunga Ottobrata con sole e temperatura miti su tutta l’Italia Torino, 11 ott (GEA) – Dopo i primi 10 giorni di ottobre all’insegna del maltempo, è in arrivo tanto sole con una bella Ottobrata su gran parte del Paese. Antonio Sanò, fondatore de iLMeteo.it, conferma la decisione di rimonta dell’alta pressione sull’Italia con la cessazione delle forti piogge che hanno colpito soprattutto il Centro-Nord nella prima decade di ottobre. Nelle prossime ore avremo ancora qualche residuo addensamento specie sul Triveneto orientale, in Toscana e sul Basso Tirreno, accompagnato da locali piovaschi; per il resto il tempo sarà in deciso miglioramento ovunque. Le temperature scenderanno leggermente a causa di venti più freschi dai quadranti settentrionali, specie al meridione ed in Sardegna, ma torneremo a percepire il calore del sole da Nord a Sud; gli ultimi 10 giorni perturbati hanno offuscato la memoria delle belle e serene giornate autunnali di una volta a molti abitanti del Centro-Nord. Nel fine settimana rivivremo queste belle giornate con il sole che tornerà ad illuminare il fogliame dei boschi; a tratti, il sole sarà disturbato da correnti più umide solo al Nord-Ovest e in montagna con addensamenti comunque non forieri di precipitazioni. Lungo le coste il sole scalderà quasi ovunque fino a valori gradevoli: sono previste massime di 28°C in Sardegna e Sicilia, fino a 27°C in Puglia e Calabria, 25-26°C in Basilicata con Napoli e Roma a 24°C , Firenze a 22°C e Milano sui 20. La media delle massime di ottobre a Milano è 18°C, sulla Capitale 22°C; entro il weekend, dunque, saliremo nelle due principali città italiane di 2 gradi oltre i valori climatologici: niente di eccezionale, ma l’umore ringrazierà, dopo tante giornate grigie. Inoltre, le ultime emissioni dei modelli indicano la possibilità della persistenza del bel tempo quasi fino alla fine del mese, con una lunga e mite Ottobrata su buona parte del Paese. In questa proiezione meteo ottimistica non sono esclusi due veloci passaggi un po’ perturbati sia venerdì 18 sia venerdì 25 ottobre; per il resto l’anticiclone dovrebbe dominare e fermarsi a lungo sul nostro Paese.

author: Jack Bamford
title: Ben Brown Secures One-Year Extension with Hampshire Cricket
text:
Table of Contents
Toggle
Contract Renewal for Hampshire’s Wicketkeeper Career Highlights and Performance Director of Cricket’s Praise Record-Breaking Partnerships and Milestones Player’s Reflection on Continued Tenure Contract Renewal for Hampshire’s Wicketkeeper
Ben Brown, the wicketkeeper for Hampshire, has officially signed a one-year extension to his contract, ensuring his place at the club through to the end of the 2025 season.
Career Highlights and Performance At 35 years old, Brown has made significant contributions to Hampshire since his arrival from Sussex in 2022, participating in 66 matches for the club. His debut season was marked by an impressive achievement as he was awarded the club’s Red-Ball Batter of the Year after scoring 969 runs with an average of 38.66.
Director of Cricket’s Praise Giles White, the director of cricket at Hampshire, commended Brown’s skills, stating, “Ben is a fantastic player. He has high standards and a will to win that keeps driving the team forward. His ability behind the stumps, coupled with his batting, makes him an extremely valuable player.”
Record-Breaking Partnerships and Milestones In his tenure, Brown notably partnered with Liam Dawson to set a new record for the fifth-wicket stand, achieving 273 runs together just weeks after his arrival at the club in April 2022. He also reached personal milestones, including a career-high score of 165 not out against Surrey in the County Championship and 139 not out against Northamptonshire in the One-Day Cup.
Player’s Reflection on Continued Tenure Expressing his enthusiasm for the renewed contract, Brown remarked, “I feel very happy to have signed another contract at Hampshire. I have loved my time playing here and I’m excited to see what this squad can achieve next season. Each year is special when you reach this stage of a career and I’m looking forward to contributing to the club pushing for trophies next season.”

author: Matilda Rudd
title: Best advent calendar on sale for beauty lovers: The Iconic has discounted its most wanted beauty box by 30 per cent
text:
Gone are the days when we’d only buy advent calendars to
countdown the days until Christmas, with a reward of simple chocolates.
Now more than ever brands are building calendars filled with gifts and travel-sized products that you can actually use long after Santa has visited.
And the best part is when they’re immediately discounted during the post-Christmas period, like
The Iconic’s “Beauty’s Most Wanted” calendar, which retailed for $249 in early December.
Catch the best deals and products hand-picked by our team at
Best Picks >>
For a
limited time only it’s 30 per cent off bringing the price down to $174.30.
Expertly curated by beauty insiders, the
Beauty’s Most Wanted collection is the ultimate edit of holy grail products from top beauty brands.
From skincare and makeup to hair, body and fragrance, it’s the perfect way to indulge in 23 hero formulas that are valued at $700.
Inside customers will get six full-sized products, 13 travel size and four deluxe minis from Medik8, Olaplex, MAC and Ultra Violette, among others.
What’s in the beauty calendar?
1. Medik8 Hydr8 B5 30ml (full size)Like a tall glass of water for your skin, Medik8’s cult moisturising serum is infused with multi-weight hyaluronic acid and vitamin B5 to leave your complexion plump, supple and hydrated from its deepest layers right to the top.
2. MAC Matte Lipstick 3g (full size)For a long-wearing matte formula that won’t leave your pout parched, you can’t beat MAC’s signature Matte Lipstick. Creamy, rich and smooth, you’ll want to try them all — but Honeylove or Taupe are great shades to start.
3. Ultra Violette Fave Fluid SPF50+ Ultralight SKINSCREEN 30mlLightweight, silky and stacked with skin-loving ingredients like niacinamide, vitamin C and vitamin E, this game-changing sunscreen from Ultra Violette is set to become your new fave. No excuses now to apply.
4. Olaplex No. 3 Hair Perfector 100ml (full size)A bestseller for a reason, this weekly at-home treatment helps reduce breakage while visibly strengthening your strands. An insider tip? Prime your hair first for even deeper repair (perfect if your mop’s in need of a little extra TLC).
5. Aspect Phytostat 9 15gThis lightweight yet nourishing moisturiser floods the skin with hydration while helping to smooth fine lines and fight free radical damage. Versatile enough for AM and PM, and suitable for all skin types? It’s the new MVP.
6. Who Is Elijah Nomad 10mlWith notes of Egyptian jasmine, saffron, and almond layered over amberwood, cedar and moss, this unisex fragrance is bound to turn heads — while still being subtle enough to wear to the grocery store.
7. Clinique Take The Day Off Cleansing Balm 30mlIf this isn’t already a staple in your evening routine, get ready: one night with this silky, lightweight balm-to-oil, and you’ll know why it’s Clinique’s #1 makeup remover. Sunscreen? Dissolved. Waterproof mascara? See you later.
8. Benefit Cosmetics 24 Hour Brow Setter 3.5mlBrows on lock all day (and night) long? Look no further. Benefit’s cult brow-setting gel boasts a dual-sized wand (for shaping *and* taming), and a flexible formula that doesn’t flake.
9. Skinstitut Gentle Cleanser 200ml (full size)Infused with soothing aloe vera, goji berry and vitamin E, this cleanser purifies and hydrates even the most sensitive of complexions. Face not that fussy? This gentle formula is also perfect pre- and post- any professional skin treatments.
10. Estée Lauder Advanced Night Repair Synchronized Multi-Recovery Complex Mini 7mlNot about that 10-step life? Estée Lauder’s bestselling serum helps to fight all key signs of ageing (think fine lines and wrinkles, tone, texture…) while keeping the complexion hydrated for up to 72 hours.
11. The Beauty Chef COLLAGEN Inner Beauty Boost 200ml (full size)Supercharge your wellness regime with this vegan, bio-fermented elixir formulated to support collagen production and defend cells against free radical damage. Healthier hair, skin and nails (and a happier gut), incoming.
12. Lancôme Lash Idôle Mascara 2.5mlA lifted, fanned-out effect *without* all the drama of false lashes? It’s possible. The magicians* at Lancôme have made a clump-free, feather-light mascara that wears flawlessly for up to 24 hours. And the best part? It’s a breeze to remove.
13. Slick Hair Co Slick Stick Anti Flyaway Hair Wand 10ml (full size)Still obsessed with Sofia Richie Grainge’s slick bun? Us too. Thankfully, this handy little hair wand houses a serum-based flyaway formula to tame stray hairs with all-day hold (sans the dreaded hairspray helmet vibes).
14. Christophe Robin Cleansing Purifying Scrub With Sea Salt 75mlCan’t remember the last time you showed your scalp some love? This deep-cleansing shampoo scrub helps to remove buildup (think oil, styling products, a little too much dry shampoo) and leave your roots feeling rebalanced and purified.
15. Real Techniques Miracle Complexion SpongeSure, you could use your fingers to apply your foundation. But when you’ve got a makeup sponge that blends, covers blemishes and navigates around tricky areas with ease, why would you?
16. Virtue Labs Healing Oil 9mlHair feeling drier than the Sahara? We got you. Virtue’s first-of-its-kind hair oil is infused with a powerful healing protein to mend, protect and restore shine to dry, damaged strands. The perfect antidote to summer sun.
17. MAKE UP FOR EVER Mist & Fix Spray 10mlAKA the only setting spray you’ll ever need. We’re obsessed with this ultra-fine, cloud-like mist that sets makeup, intensifies shadow colour, quenches skin and keeps powdery vibes at bay. Hot tip? Spritz a little after you apply each product to lock your layers in place.
18. Billie Eilish No.2 Eilish 7.5mlFans of Billie’s first fragrance and newcomers alike will love this dark, woody, alluring twist on the original. Fun fact: Billie was guided by her synesthesia, which involves all her senses to see colour, texture and shape, when creating her second-act scent.
19. L’Occitane Almond Shower Oil 35mlThis bestselling shower oil is a cult fave for a reason. Its silky oil-to-milk formula softens and nourishes the skin (perfect for pre-shaving!), gently cleanses and smells incredible. We reach for it any time we want to feel a little luxe.
20. MAKE UP FOR EVER Aqua Resist Color Pencil 0.2gWhether you want kohl, liner or shadow, this multitasking pencil ticks all the boxes. Its ultra-pigmented formula stays waterproof, sweat- and smudge-proof for 24 hours, and plays nice with sensitive eyes to boot.
21. Aveda Nutriplenish Masque Light Moisture 25mlLush locks, unlocked. This nutrient-infused hydrating treatment floods your hair with superfood ingredients (think pomegranate seed oil, mango butter and coconut oil) for softer, smoother, more manageable hair — without weighing you down.
22. Yves Saint Laurent Libre EDP 7.5mlA beauty insider favourite, Yves Saint Laurent’s Libre is a soft yet sensual floral scent that’ll quickly become your signature. Spritz on your pulse points for an intoxicating aura that lasts all day.
23. First Aid Beauty KP Bump Eraser with 10% AHA 28.3gPerfect for tackling rough texture on the body, this fast-acting scrub combines glycolic and lactic acids to help loosen the skin’s top layer and slough away decongestion. Say hello to smoother, clearer skin in no time.
To purchase the calendar,
visit The Iconic here.
